conversations_v0.question: Examine the image closely and share its details.
conversations_v0.answer: This diagram shows the process called Phagocytosis. Through this process, our defense system fights bacteria and destroys them keeping them out of our system. An amoeba is a type of cell or organism which has the ability to alter its shape, primarily by extending and retracting pseudopods. Once the white blood cells detect any inflammation, they go to where damaged tissue is located and eat pathogens and dead cells by engulfing and destroying them. In order to do this, bacteria is digested and nutrients are absorbed and the waste products are expulsed out by the amoeba.

conversations_v0.question:
What happens after the phagocyte consumes a foreign particle?
a. A phagosome is formed.
b. It adheres to the microbe.
c. It is digested.
d. Waste material is discharged.

In the process of phagocytosis, what organelle fuses with the phagosome after a microbe has been ingested by the cell?
a. Lysosome
b. Phagolysosome
c. Lysozyme
d. Pseudopod

What happens before ingestion of the microbe?
a. Discharge of waste materials
b. Formation of a phagosome
c. Chemotaxis and adherence of microbe to phagocyte
d. Microbe passes through the plasma membrane
conversations_v0.answer: c Chemotaxis and adherence of microbe to phagocyte
